Title: Food waste prevention services in north London
Description:
North London Waste Authority (NLWA) is running an extensive waste prevention programme from 1 April 2018 to 31 March 2020 focusing on reducing local authority collected waste in north London. The 2018-20 programme of activity has recently been agreed and will include intensive activity to reduce three priority waste streams: food, furniture and textiles.

We are seeking to appoint contractors to complement the work that NLWA will deliver in 2018/19 by developing, organising and running a range of food waste prevention activities around bread, which is one of the food items more likely to be wasted. The aim is to raise awareness of the level of bread that goes to waste, provide north London residents with tips and advice to make the most of the bread they buy, and promote bread waste reduction messages alongside money saving messages.

There will be an option to extend the contract in 2019/20 at the discretion of NLWA. Further details of the waste prevention programme of activity for 2018/20 as approved by Authority Members at the February 2018 Authority meeting can be viewed at http://nlwa.gov.uk/media/2422/13-waste-prevention-plan-2018-20-web.pdf.

Title: Roadside litter survey
Description:
(previously 24918 - now retendered)

To provide an assessment, by local authority (district/unitary council) of the state of roadside litter on trunk roads other than motorways by measuring site cleanliness grade pertaining to litter. It would be useful (but not essential) to also have a record of the most commonly occurring types of litter. 

The data are required to inform policy development and to assist the Litter Strategy for England.

Title: SCC LP SWP Door Stepping Campaign  - AWARD
Description:
Surrey County Council (SCC) is working on behalf of the Surrey Waste Partnership (SWP), to procure a doorstepping exercise in Surrey. (The SWP is made up of SCC acting as the Waste Disposal Authority (WDA), and the 11 District & Boroughs acting as the Waste Collection Authorities (WCAs) in Surrey.) The SWP is looking to carry out the doorstepping campaign in mid-low performing recycling rounds, which have high levels of contamination, within 9 of its 11 authorities (not including Epsom & Ewell Borough Council and Reigate & Banstead Borough Council). These rounds include both individual households and households of multiple occupancy. 

As both low recycling rates and contaminated recycling continue to be an issue in parts of Surrey, the SWP would like the doorstepping to address these issues with targeted messages and conversations. By being able to speak face to face in targeted areas, doorsteppers will be able to tackle the resident barriers to recycling and recycling the correct materials.

Please see the attached Documentation for a full description of the requirement

Organisation Name: DEPARTMENT FOR ENVIRONMENT, FOOD & RURAL AFFAIRS
Title: Local Environmental quality survey of England
Description: The aim of the project is to analyse data that has been collected during 2014/2015 under the Local Environmental Quality Survey in England and produce a 30 page report that will deliver an overall picture of the standard of local environmental quality in England. This report will provide useful information on where and what problems are, along with assessing the make-up of the problems. It will also explore what significant changes there have been when reviewing trends over time, which is informative for local and national government, policy makers, organisations working to improve local environmental quality and private sector organisations, while at the same time raising awareness with members of the public.
